Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by:  Rabbi Jonathan Glass, Civic Center Synagogue, 49 White Street, New York, New York  10013.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Weprin.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Rabbi Jonathan Glass, Civic Center Synagogue, 49 White Street, New York, N.Y. 10013.

Council Member Weprin moved  that the Invocation be spread in full upon the Minutes and adopted.

Resolution calling upon the Republican National Committee to repudiate the irresponsible and dangerous policies of the National Rifle Association; and further calling upon the Republican National Committee to denounce the intolerant and inflammatory comments made by members of the National Rifle Association leadership that are offensive to many communities that bring to the City the diversity that ensures its vibrancy.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.MinutesNote: Adopted by voice vote.  The item following 7 Council Members formally objected to the pasage of this item: Council Members Avella, Gallagher, Gennaro, Jennings, Lanza, Sears and Oddo.
Items.MatterName: Republican National Committee to repudiate the irresponsible and dangerous policies of the National Rifle Association.

Items.Title: Resolution supporting Hungarian Holocaust survivors as they seek justice from the United States government for its mishandling of the “Gold Train;” and further urging the United States Department of Justice to stop resisting these elderly survivors, and instead to promptly reach a fair settlement with them as a modest and overdue measure of justice.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.MinutesNote: Adopted by voice vote.  The following Council Member formally abstained from voting on this matter: Council Member Avella.
Items.MatterName: Supporting Hungarian Holocaust survivors as they seek justice from the U.S. Gov't for its mishandling of the "Gold Train".

Items.Title:
Introduction & Reading of Bills
See Attached
General Discussion
Extension of Remarks
INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.5885, and Assembly Member Titus, A.9678, “AN ACT authorizing the city of New York to reconvey its interest in certain real property acquired by in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of Queens to former owner Bernadette C. Ernst, notwithstanding expiration of the two year period within which application may be made to the city to release its interest in property thus acquired; Block No. 11820, Lot No. 38 on tax map for the borough of Queens”.
Items.MatterName: In rem, Bernadette Ernst, Queens (S.5885, A.9678)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the enforcement of stop-work orders issued by the department of buildings.
Items.MatterName: Enforcement of stop-work orders issued by the department of buildings.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to demolition work without a permit.
Items.MatterName: Demolition work without a permit.

Items.Title: Resolution declaring March 21, 2004 as “Reparation Awareness Day” and to recognize the Trans-Atlantic Slave Trade and Slavery as crimes against humanity.
Items.MatterName: March 21, 2004 as "Reparation Awareness Day"

Items.Title: Resolution declaring April 9th, 2004 as “Paul Robeson Day” in the City of New York.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Paul Robeson Day, April 9th, 2003

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the City Council to convene an emergency summit to address the concerns highlighted in the recent Community Service Society report, “A Crisis in Black Male Employment,” including the need for employment services, training, and educational and technological programs, which specifically target the employment disparities and disadvantages facing the African-American community.
Items.MatterName: Community Service Society report, "A Crisis in Black Male Employment."

Items.Title: Resolution mourning the death and celebrating the life, works, achievements and sacrifice of Professor Edward W. Said.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Mourning the death and celebrating the life Professor Edward W. Said.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on President George W. Bush to immediately withdraw all United States military forces from Iraq before the one-year anniversary of the war with Iraq.
Items.MatterName: President Bush to immediately withdraw all US military forces from Iraq before the one-year anniversary of the war with Iraq.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to income verification for tenants or cooperators residing in housing developments owned by city-supervised limited-profit housing companies organized pursuant to article II of the private housing finance law.
Items.MatterName: Income verification for tenants or cooperators residing in housing developments owned by city-supervised limited-profit housing companies.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York in relation to flammables and combustibles and penalties recoverable in proceedings before the environmental control board, and to repeal subdivision c of section 27-4065, subdivision b of section 27-4069, and subdivisions a, b and c of section 27-4070, to repeal and reenact subdivisions 10 and 22 of section 27-4002, sections 27-4015, 27-4063, 27-4064, 27-4066, 27-4067, 27-4068 and 27-4070 of such code.
Items.MatterName: In relation to flammables and combustibles.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to mechanical refrigeration and to repeal  subchapter 18 of chapter 4 of title 27 relating to mechanical refrigeration.
Items.MatterName: In relation to mechanical refrigeration.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of  New York, in relation to overcrowding.
Items.MatterName: In relation to overcrowding.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Andrews, S.5927, and Assembly Member Norman, A.9413, “AN ACT authorizing the city of New York to reconvey its interest in certain real property acquired by in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of Brooklyn to former owner Doreen Harris, notwithstanding expiration of the two year period within which application may be made to the city to release its interest in property thus acquired; Block No. 48, Lot No. 36 on tax map for the borough of Brooklyn”.
Items.MatterName: In rem, Doreen Harris, Brooklyn (S.5927, A.9413)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Norman, A.6740-A, “AN ACT authorizing the city of New York to reconvey its interest in certain real property acquired by in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of Brooklyn to Jacquesline Menaged, notwithstanding expiration of the two year period within which application may be made to the city to release its interest in property thus acquired; Block No. 1330, Lot No. 32 on the tax map for the borough of Brooklyn”.
Items.MatterName: In rem, Jacquesline Menaged, Brooklyn (A.6740-A)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to truck routing sheets and maps depicting legal truck routes.
Items.MatterName: Truck routing sheets and maps depicting legal truck routes.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the Charter of the city of New York, in relation to any person appointed to a board or commission in New York City, being a resident of New York City.
Items.MatterName: Appointment Residency Requirement

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the repair of leaks occurring in certain portions of service pipes by the Department of Environmental Protection.
Items.MatterName: Leak Repair Service Pipes

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to licensing of demolition contractors and providing for the registration of demolition contracting businesses.
Items.MatterName: Demoliton Business Registration

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring construction site safety coordinators on demolition sites.
Items.MatterName: Requiring construction site safety coordinators on demolition sites.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing a temporary interagency task force to determine whether existing laws, rules, practices and procedures provide sufficient public safety in publicly- and privately-owned and managed buildings.
Items.MatterName: Buildings, Public Safety Task Force

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing a computerized database containing information relating to the storage and handling of hazardous substances and emergency responses to the release of hazardous substances.
Items.MatterName: Hazardous Substance Database

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to emergency lighting and exit signs.
Items.MatterName: Emergency lighting and exit signs.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation exempting business and homeowners from the requirement of obtaining a permit to post a non-commercial flag.
Items.MatterName: Exempting business and homeowners from the requirement of obtaining a permit to post a non-commercial flag.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the repair and maintenance of street and sidewalk surfaces.
Items.MatterName: Repair and maintenance of street and sidewalk surfaces.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to removing the prohibition on sidewalk obstructions on certain streets in Brooklyn.
Items.MatterName: Removing prohibition on sidewalk obstructions, Brooklyn

Items.Title: Resolution commending the New York State Assembly for passing A.9710, a bill that would increase the minimum wage to $7.10, and calling upon the New York State Senate to pass the accompanying legislation, S.3291-C, and for the Governor to sign the bill into law.
Items.MatterName: Increasing the state minimum wage from $5.15 to $7.10 per hour.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring that the New York city department of education provide voter registration forms to students.
Items.MatterName: Dep't of education of the city of New York provide voter registration forms to students.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to public hearings on contract awards.
Items.MatterName: Public hearings on contract awards.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to competitive sealed bids and proposals from prequalified vendors.
Items.MatterName: Competitive sealed bids and proposals from prequalified vendors.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to prequalification.
Items.MatterName: In relation to prequalification.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to intergovernmental procurement.
Items.MatterName: In relation to intergovernmental procurement.

Items.Title: Resolution urging Mayor Michael Bloomberg and the Department for the Aging to immediately withdraw the Request for Proposal to restructure the Bronx home-delivered meals program.
Items.MatterName: Withdraw the Request for Proposal to restructure the Bronx home-delivered meals program.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the installation of partitions or security devices capable of capturing visual images in certain for-hire vehicles.
Items.MatterName: For-Hire Vehicles, Installation of Partititions & Security Devices

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the city to secure the consent of a property owner prior to the city planting a tree adjacent to his or her property.
Items.MatterName: City secure consent of property owner before planting trees adjacent to their property.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York City charter, in relation to the administration for children’s services.
Items.MatterName: Administration for children's services.

Items.Title: Resolution strongly denouncing Con Edison for its failure to create and implement effective policies and procedures to identify and correct problems relating to voltage leaks from manhole covers and service boxes and calls upon the State of New York to require all utility companies to create effective protocols to address the issues pertaining to the safe transmission and distribution of electricity.
Items.MatterName: Voltage leaks from manhole covers, denouncing Con Edison

Items.Title: Resolution opposing President Bush’s FY 2005 budget proposal to drastically cut funding for the Section 8 Housing Choice Voucher program and replace it with block grants to local housing authorities and calling upon the Congress of the United States to reject this proposal.
Items.MatterName: Opposing FY'05 budget proposal to drastically cut funding for the Section 8 Housing Choice Voucher program.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the federal Department of Veterans Affairs to implement the recommendations of the American Veterans for Equal Rights.
Items.MatterName: Implement the recommendations of the American Veterans for Equal Rights.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to a for-hire vehicle driver manual.
Items.MatterName: For-hire vehicle driver manual.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to the administrative tribunal of the taxi and limousine commission.
Items.MatterName: Administrative tribunal of the taxi and limousine commission.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Governor and Legislature of the State of New York to amend the Education Law to permit the New York City Department of Education to assign schoolchildren in pre-Kindergarten through 8th grade to schools located outside of the Community School District in which they live.
Items.MatterName: Assign schoolchildren in pre-Kindergarten through 8th grade to schools located outside of the CD's in which they live.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city administrative code in relation to requiring sight-seeing buses that offer tour narration to provide such narration from a live sight-seeing guide.
Items.MatterName: Sight-seeing buses that offer tour narratin to provide such narration from a live sight-seeing guide.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring every individual, corporation or other entity with fifty or more employees in New York City to offer such employees the opportunity to use pre-tax earnings to purchase qualified transportation benefits in accordance with federal law.
Items.MatterName: NYC Employees the opportunity to use pre-tax earnings to purchase qualified transportation benefits in accordance with federal law.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to awnings.
Items.MatterName: In relation to awnings.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass Assembly Bill 09292 (A.09292), to amend the Penal Law so that the making of swastikas on public or private property without permission of the property owner, or the burning of a cross anywhere in public view, is a class “E” felony.
Items.MatterName: Swastikas on public or private property without permission of the property owner, or the burning of a cross anywhere in public view, is a class "E" felony.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting the use of non-wood bats by high school age children.
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting the use of non-wood bats by minors.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring that commercial film and photographic print processors report child pornography to law enforcement officials.
Items.MatterName: Reporting of Child Pornography

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the issuance of violations  to residential property owners for failure to keep abutting sidewalks free from litter.
Items.MatterName: Issuance of violations to residential property owners for failure to keep abutting sidewalks free from litter.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the prosecution of violations of department of buildings stop work orders before the environmental control board.
Items.MatterName: Prosecution of violations of DOB stop work orders before the environmental control board.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to declaring buildings or parts thereof that are located in certain commercial districts for certain commercial or manufacturing uses in violation of the zoning resolution to be a public nuisance.
Items.MatterName: Declaring buildings or parts thereof that are located in certain commercial districts for certain commercial or manufacturing uses in violation of the zoning resolution to be a public nuisance.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Mayor to instruct the City Clerk to recognize the fundamental rights of same-sex partners by issuing marriage licenses to same-sex couples in the City of New York.
Items.MatterName: Recognize the fundamental rights of same-sex partners by issuing marriage licenses to same-sex couples in NYC.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to providing for reasonable reimbursement to participants in the Campaign Finance Program for costs associated with post-election audits.
Items.MatterName: Providing for reimbursement to participants in the Campaign Finance Program for costs associated with post-election audits.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.2070-A, and Assembly Member Seminerio, A.4595-A, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the composition of the board of trustees of the New York city employees’ retirement system”.
Items.MatterName: Composition of the board of trustees of the New York city employee's retirement system (S.2070-A, A.4595-A)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Maltese, S.1830-A, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to eligibility of uniformed personnel of the New York city department of correction for ordinary disability benefits”.
Items.MatterName: Eligibility of uniformed personnel of the New York city department of correction for ordinary disability benefits (S.1830-A)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.2028-A, and Assembly Member Seminerio, A.4426-A, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to permitting certain New York city correction members to borrow from their accumulated member contributions and to repeal certain provisions of the retirement and social security law relating thereto”.
Items.MatterName: Permitting certain New York city correction members to borrow from their accumulated member contributions (S.2028-A, A.4426-A)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.2029-A, and Assembly Member Seminerio, A.4427-A, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to the return of member contributions”.
Items.MatterName: Return of member contributions (S.2029-A, A.4427-A)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.2071-A, and Assembly Member Seminerio, A.4594-A, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to disability retirement of certain New York city correction members”.
Items.MatterName: Disability retirement of certain New York city correction members (S.2071-A, A.4594-A)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Velella, S.1844-A, and Assembly Member Seminerio, A.4214-A, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to loans to correction members of the New York city employees’ retirement system”.
Items.MatterName: Loans to correction members of the New York city employees' retirement system (S.1844-A, A.4214-A)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Velella, S.2367-A, and Assembly Members Abbate, Carrozza, Lavelle, Cymbrowitz and Seddio, et al, A.5174-A, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to the determination of benefits of correction members of the New York city employees’ retirement system”.
Items.MatterName: Determination of benefits of correction members of the New York city employees' retirement system (S.2367-A, A.5174-A)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Skelos, S.2124-B, and Assembly Members DiNapoli, Hooper, Sidikman and Weisenberg, et al, A.6064-A, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to allowing the transfer of membership from the New York city police pension fund to the metropolitan transportation authority police pension fund”.
Items.MatterName: Allowing the transfer of membership from the New York city police pension fund to the mta police pension fund (S.2124-B, A.6064-A)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Velella, S.2365-A, and Assembly Members Abbate, Colton, Aubry, Seddio, Cymbrowitz and Lavelle, et al, A.5175-A, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to allowing correction members of the New York city employees’ retirement system to obtain retirement credit for certain periods of child care leave”.
Items.MatterName: Allowing correction members of the New York city employees' retirement system to obtain retirement credit for certain periods of child care leave (S.2365-A, A.5175-A)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Committee on Rules, A.8547, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the registration of property and designation of mailing address”.
Items.MatterName: Registration of property and designation of mailing address (A.8547)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.2899, and Assembly Member Seminerio, A.3087, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the designation of deputy warden (warden level II) in the department of correction of the city of New York”.
Items.MatterName: Designation of deputy warden (warden level II) in the department of correction (S.2899, A.3087)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Velella, S.1881-A, and Assembly Member Seminerio, A.4261-A, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to retirement allowances payable to correction members of the New York city employees’ retirement system”.
Items.MatterName: Retirement allowances payable to correction members of the New York city employees' retirement system (S.1881-A, A.4261-A

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Seminerio, A.3094, “AN ACT to amend the general municipal law and the public officers law, in relation to the code of ethics of public officers”.
Items.MatterName: Code of ethics of public officers (A.3094)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Stavisky, S.6271, and Assembly Member Grodenchik, A.9893, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring certain contract terms or agreements be written in the language in which such contracts or agreements were negotiated ”.
Items.MatterName: Requiring certain contract terms or agreements be written in the language in which such contracts or agreements were negotiated (S.6271, A.9893)

Items.Title: Resolution honoring the life of Nuyorican poet and playwright Pedro “El Reverendo” Pietri.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Honoring the life of Nuyorican poet and playwright Pedro "El Reverendo" Pietri.

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Miller), the Clerk of the Council adjourned to meet again on Wednesday, March 24, 2004.
VICTOR L. ROBLES, City Clerk
